WorkItem.Description:
When writing to an existing file AND using the chart support workarournd code as found in:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=48411
a formula like:
=if($a1>0, $b1/$a1, "no data")
returns "no data", even when 'logical_test' returns true
WorkItem.Summary: Formula 'hard codes' strings when a formula can return either a string or a value

Comments.Message: The IF() function should work correctly. Can you please upload an example file that demonstrates this problem.
